intro: Eriope trichopes, commonly known as the woolly thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its dense, soft, white to grayish woolly covering on its stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces purple to pinkish flower heads that are composed of many small florets. It is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Eriope trichopes is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
